name: Interventionism
description: The belief that a state or group of states has the moral, political, or strategic obligation to actively intervene in the affairs of other nations—through military force, economic pressure, or diplomatic coercion—to achieve specific ends deemed universally beneficial or essential to the intervener’s worldview.

name: Protectionism
description: The economic policy of restricting imports from other countries through methods such as tariffs on imported goods, import quotas, and a variety of other government regulations.

name: Conservatism
description: A political philosophy emphasizing tradition, authority, and the preservation of established institutions.

name: Liberalism
description: A political and social philosophy emphasizing individual rights, democracy, and the rule of law.

name: Pacifism
description: A belief in non-violence and opposition to war or conflict as a means of resolving disputes.

name: Nationalism
description: A political ideology emphasizing the interests and culture of a particular nation, often to the exclusion of others.

name: Environmentalism
description: A political and social movement advocating for the protection and preservation of the natural environment.

name: Fascism
description: A far-right political ideology emphasizing authoritarianism, nationalism, and the supremacy of the state.

name: Anarchism
description: A political philosophy advocating for the abolition of hierarchical authority and the establishment of voluntary cooperation.

name: Libertarianism
description: A political philosophy emphasizing individual liberty, free markets, and limited government intervention.

name: Communism
description: A political and economic system advocating for a classless society and common ownership of the means of production.

name: Capitalism
description: An economic system based on private ownership of the means of production and the pursuit of profit.

name: Socialism
description: A political and economic system advocating for collective ownership and control of the means of production.

name: Feminism
description: A social and political movement advocating for the rights and equality of women.

name: Objectivism
description: A philosophical system developed by Ayn Rand, emphasizing rational self-interest and individualism.

name: Utilitarianism
description: A moral theory emphasizing the greatest happiness for the greatest number of people.

name: Nihilism
description: A philosophical belief that life is without objective meaning, purpose, or intrinsic value.

name: Hedonism
description: A philosophical stance emphasizing pleasure and happiness as the highest good.

name: Stoicism
description: A school of philosophy founded in ancient Greece, emphasizing self-control, virtue, and acceptance of fate.

name: Existentialism
description: A philosophical movement emphasizing individual freedom, choice, and responsibility in a seemingly indifferent universe.

name: Humanism
description: A philosophical and ethical stance emphasizing the value and agency of human beings, often rejecting supernatural beliefs.

name: Agnosticism
description: A belief that the existence of gods or deities is unknown or unknowable, often involving skepticism or doubt.

name: Atheism
description: A lack of belief in gods or deities, often characterized by skepticism or rejection of religious claims.

name: Wicca
description: A modern pagan religion focused on nature worship, magic, and personal spiritual growth.

name: Raelism
description: A UFO religion founded by Claude Vorilhon, teaching that life on Earth was created by extraterrestrial beings.

name: Tenrikyo
description: A Japanese religion founded by Miki Nakayama, focused on the divine nature of humanity.

name: Cao Dai
description: A syncretic religion originating in Vietnam, combining elements of many world religions.

name: Vodou
description: A syncretic religion practiced primarily in Haiti, blending African traditions with Christianity.

name: Unitarian Universalism
description: A liberal religion characterized by a free and responsible search for truth and meaning.

name: Scientology
description: A modern religion founded by L. Ron Hubbard, focusing on self-improvement and spiritual enlightenment.

name: Rastafarianism
description: A religion originating in Jamaica, emphasizing African heritage and the worship of Haile Selassie.

name: Druze
description: A monotheistic religion originating in the Middle East, combining elements of Islam and other philosophies.

name: Paganism
description: A broad term for polytheistic religions often associated with ancient or indigenous traditions.

name: Animism
description: A belief system that all things, including animals, plants, and inanimate objects, have a spirit.

name: Baha'i Faith
description: A monotheistic religion emphasizing the spiritual unity of all humankind, founded by Bahá'u'lláh.

name: Jainism
description: An ancient Indian religion advocating for non-violence, truth, and asceticism.

name: Zoroastrianism
description: An ancient Persian religion founded by Zoroaster, emphasizing dualism between good and evil.

name: Confucianism
description: A philosophy and system of ethics originating in China, based on the teachings of Confucius.

name: Taoism
description: A philosophical and religious tradition of Chinese origin emphasizing living in harmony with the Tao.

name: Shinto
description: The traditional religion of Japan, centered on the worship of kami (spirits) and nature.

name: Sikhism
description: A monotheistic religion founded in Punjab by Guru Nanak, emphasizing equality and devotion to God.

name: Judaism
description: A monotheistic religion of the Jewish people, based on the Torah and other Hebrew scriptures.

name: Buddhism
description: A religion and philosophy founded by Siddhartha Gautama (the Buddha) focused on achieving enlightenment and escaping suffering.

name: Hinduism
description: An ancient religion originating in India, characterized by a belief in reincarnation and a supreme being with many forms.

name: Islam
description: A monotheistic religion that believes in Allah and follows the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: Christianity
description: A monotheistic religion based on the life and teachings of Jesus Christ.

name: Chemistry
description: The science of substances, their properties, and reactions.

name: Physics
description: The study of matter, energy, and the fundamental forces of nature.

name: Political Science
description: The study of governments, political systems, and public policies.

name: Anthropology
description: The study of humans, their behavior, and societies.

name: Engineering
description: The application of scientific principles to design and build systems, machines, and structures.

name: Medicine
description: The science of diagnosing, treating, and preventing illness.

name: Computer Science
description: The study of computational systems, algorithms, and data processing.

name: Economics
description: The study of production, consumption, and distribution of goods and services.

name: Sociology
description: The study of social behavior, organizations, and institutions.

name: Geology
description: The science of the Earth, its materials, processes, and history.

name: Mathematics
description: The abstract study of numbers, patterns, and structures.

name: Environmental Science
description: The study of the environment and how to protect it.

name: Psychology
description: The science of behavior and mental processes.

name: Astronomy
description: The study of celestial bodies and the universe beyond Earth's atmosphere.

name: Biology
description: The study of living organisms and their interactions with the environment.

name: Populism
description: A political ideology that emphasizes the will of 'the people' against a perceived elite or establishment, often transcending traditional left-right divides.

name: Technocracy
description: An ideology advocating for governance by experts, typically scientists or engineers, based on technical knowledge rather than political affiliation.

name: Globalism
description: An ideology promoting interconnectedness, free trade, and supranational cooperation over national sovereignty.

name: Isolationism
description: A policy or ideology favoring non-involvement in international affairs, prioritizing domestic focus and self-sufficiency.

name: Progressivism
description: A political and social ideology advocating for reform, modernization, and social justice, often challenging traditional structures.

name: Pragmatism
description: A philosophical approach emphasizing practical consequences and real-world applications as the basis for truth and meaning.

name: Absurdism
description: A philosophy, linked to existentialism, asserting that the universe is inherently meaningless, yet humans must create their own purpose.

name: Epicureanism
description: An ancient Greek philosophy teaching that pleasure (moderately pursued) and the avoidance of pain are the highest goods.

name: Phenomenology
description: A philosophical method focusing on the structures of experience and consciousness as they appear to the individual.

name: Postmodernism
description: A philosophical and cultural movement questioning grand narratives, objective truth, and embracing relativism and diversity.

name: Falun Gong
description: A modern Chinese spiritual practice blending Buddhist and Taoist elements, emphasizing meditation, morality, and energy cultivation.

name: Yazidism
description: An ancient monotheistic religion from the Kurdish region, centered on the worship of a supreme God and reverence for the Peacock Angel.

name: Theosophy
description: A spiritual movement founded by Helena Blavatsky, blending Eastern and Western esoteric traditions to explore universal wisdom.

name: Sufism
description: A mystical branch of Islam focused on spiritual purification, divine love, and direct experience of God.

name: Satanism (LaVeyan)
description: A modern atheistic religion founded by Anton LaVey, emphasizing individualism, skepticism, and symbolic rebellion against traditional norms.

name: Neuroscience
description: The scientific study of the nervous system, brain function, and their relation to behavior and cognition.

name: Linguistics
description: The scientific study of language, its structure, evolution, and social use.

name: Archaeology
description: The study of human history and prehistory through the excavation and analysis of artifacts and physical remains.

name: Ecology
description: The scientific study of interactions between organisms and their environments.

name: Statistics
description: The science of collecting, analyzing, and interpreting numerical data to understand patterns and make predictions.

name: Evolution (Darwinism)
description: A scientific theory proposing that species develop through natural selection and adaptation over time.

name: Psychoanalysis (Freudianism)
description: A theory and therapeutic method developed by Sigmund Freud, emphasizing the unconscious mind, repression, and early experiences.

name: Relativity
description: Albert Einstein’s theory describing the relationship between space, time, gravity, and energy, revolutionizing physics.

name: Quantum Theory
description: A scientific framework explaining the behavior of matter and energy at microscopic scales, challenging classical physics.

name: Systems Theory
description: An interdisciplinary theory studying complex systems, their interactions, and emergent properties across natural and social sciences.

name: Woke Ideology
description: A social and political stance emphasizing awareness of systemic injustices—particularly around race, gender, and class—and advocating for progressive change to address them. Often tied to concepts like intersectionality and critical theory.

name: LGBT Movement
description: A social and political movement advocating for the rights, recognition, and equality of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender individuals, often extending to broader queer identities. Emphasizes liberation from traditional norms and legal protections.

name: Queer Theory
description: An intellectual framework and ideology questioning fixed categories of gender and sexuality, advocating for fluidity and the deconstruction of normative social structures. Rooted in postmodernism and often linked to LGBT activism.

name: Intersectionality
description: An ideology and analytical framework asserting that overlapping social identities (e.g., race, gender, class) create unique experiences of oppression or privilege, requiring holistic approaches to justice. Popularized by Kimberlé Crenshaw.

name: Transgender Rights Movement
description: A social and political movement focused on securing equality, healthcare access, and societal acceptance for transgender and gender-nonconforming individuals, often challenging binary gender norms.

name: Social Justice Movement
description: A broad ideology and movement advocating for equitable distribution of resources, opportunities, and rights, with a focus on dismantling systemic inequalities based on race, gender, class, or other markers.

name: Antifa (Anti-Fascism)
description: A decentralized political movement and ideology opposing fascism, racism, and authoritarianism through direct action, often including protest and confrontation. Rejects hierarchical organization.

name: Critical Race Theory (CRT)
description: An academic and ideological framework asserting that racism is embedded in legal, social, and economic systems, requiring structural change beyond individual prejudice. Originated in legal scholarship.

name: Men’s Rights Movement
description: A social and political movement advocating for the rights and interests of men, often focusing on issues like family law, gender roles, and perceived biases against men in modern society.

name: Inclusivism
description: An ideology promoting the inclusion of diverse identities and perspectives in social, political, and cultural spaces, often tied to policies like affirmative action or diversity quotas.
